cds.util

Class AsciiTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • cds.util.AsciiTable

  • public class AsciiTable
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class manages an ascii table: it receives lines to add, made of columns separated by a given separator char. Columns can be aligned (RIGHT, LEFT or CENTER) before display
    Version:
    1.0 May 2008 Creation
    , 1.1 May 2008 Fix a bug: lines are kept without a newline at the end
    , 1.2 Jun 2008 Add a toString method (items aligned).
    Fix a bug in align() when the last line is not full
    Author:
    Marc Wenger/CDS

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsciiTable

        public AsciiTable(char separ)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        separ - character defining the column separator in the input lines

    • Method Detail

      • addHeaderLine

        public void addHeaderLine(java.lang.String headerline)
        Add a header line. Several lines of header can be defined.
        Parameters:
        headerline - header string

      • endHeaderLine

        public void endHeaderLine(java.lang.String postfix)
        Specifies that the header lines are finished. This call is mandatory
        Parameters:
        postfix - String to append after the header lines (i.e. "\n")
        See Also:
        endHeaderLine()

      • endHeaderLine

        public void endHeaderLine()
        Specifies that the header lines are finished. This call is mandatory
        See Also:
        endHeaderLine(String)

      • addLine

        public void addLine(java.lang.String line)
        Add a line to the table
        Parameters:
        line - string containing the line with all the columns separated by the column separator. The line should not end up with a newline char. If it is the case, alignement errors can be experienced depending on the alignement type of the last column.

      • displayRaw

        public java.lang.String[] displayRaw()
        Get all the lines without alignement, as they were entered
        Returns:
        the array of the lines in the table

      • displayRaw

        public java.lang.String[] displayRaw(char newsep)
        Get all the lines without alignement, as they were entered, with separator control
        Parameters:
        newsep - separator to use, replacing the original one
        Returns:
        the array of the lines in the table

      • displayAligned

        public java.lang.String[] displayAligned(int[] pos)
        Get all the lines in the table, properly aligned.
        Parameters:
        pos - array of flags, indicating how each column should be justified. The array must have as many columns as the table has. Each column can contain either AsciiTable.LEFT, AsciiTable.CENTER or AsciiTable.RIGHT
        if the array contains ONE item, it will be used for every column.
        Returns:
        an array of the table lines, aligned and justified

      • displayAligned

        public java.lang.String[] displayAligned(int[] pos,
                                char newsep)
        Get all the lines in the table, properly aligned.
        Parameters:
        pos - array of flags, indicating how each column should be justified. The array must have as many columns as the table has. Each column can contain either AsciiTable.LEFT, AsciiTable.CENTER or AsciiTable.RIGHT
        if the array contains ONE item, it will be used for every column.
        newsep - separator to use, replacing the original one
        Returns:
        an array of the table lines, aligned and justified

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Display the whole table, with left alignement
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the table as a unique string
